meanings.definition: To take possession of a mortgaged property as a result of the owner's failure to keep up mortgage payments.
meanings.sent1: The bank was foreclosing on the house because the owner couldn't pay the mortgage.
meanings.sent2: The lender had to foreclose on the property when the payments were not made.
meanings.sent3: The house felt sad as the bank was foreclosing on it, but the owner promised to find a solution.
meanings.sent4: The bank's decision to foreclose on the property was like a storm cloud looming over the owner.
meanings.sent5: The act of foreclosing on the house was a harsh reality check for the owner.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from doing something by taking action first.
meanings.sent1: By arriving early, she was foreclosing any chance of being late for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher wanted to foreclose any disruptions by setting clear rules at the beginning of the class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel cleverly foreclosed the bird from reaching the feeder by guarding it all day.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking foreclosed any doubts about his ability to handle the situation.
meanings.sent5: The team's strategy was to foreclose the opponent's chances of scoring by maintaining a strong defense.
